subject: Sales
title: The Anatomy of a Lost Deal
description: One-minute skill: The Anatomy of a Lost Deal.

hook.text: The proposal was flawless. The demo sparkled. The buyer ghosted anyway. What actually went wrong?

buildup.text: Lost deals aren't random. Most fail at predictable points that sellers rarely bother to examine.

discovery.text: The top deal-killers: wrong stakeholder, unclear urgency, and no compelling event to force a decision.

twist.text: Sellers blame price. Research says price is rarely the real issue â€” it's usually a proxy for doubt.

climax.text: Autopsy every lost deal. The patterns reveal exactly what to fix before the next pitch begins.

punchline.text: Lost deals are lessons. Study them or repeat them.

quiz.question: What is the most common real reason deals are lost?
options: Wrong stakeholder, unclear urgency, or no compelling event
